Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: The FUSION Study - Islet Expression and Regulation
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: The Finland-United States Investigation of NIDDM Genetics (FUSION) Study - Islet Expression and Regulation by RNAseq and ATACseq
Configuration.Description: We analyzed mRNA extracted from pancreatic islets obtained from 31 deceased donors, along with genome-wide genotypes, and open chromatin information obtained from ATAC-seq experiments on two additional islet samples. 2500-5000 islet equivalents (IEQ) from each islet distribution were harvested for RNA isolation. 500-1000 IEQ were cultured as in Gershengorn (Science, 2004; PMID: 15564314); genomic DNA isolated from islet cultures was used for genotyping. Messenger RNA was isolated using trizol extraction in the Collins lab at the NIH. The RNA was poly-A selected and 12-plex libraries were generated using the Illumina TruSeq directional mRNA-seq library protocol. RNA sequencing was performed on HiSeq2000 sequencers using 101bp paired-end reads at the NIH Intramural Sequencing Center (NISC). Genotyping on the Illumina Omni2.5M array was performed at the Genetic Resources Core Facility of the Johns Hopkins Institute of Genetic Medicine. Genotypes were imputed using the 1000 Genomes phase3 release 5 reference panel.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Islet samples from deceased donors were obtained from the Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP), the National Disease Research Interchange (NDRI), and ProdoLabs.

For RNAseq and eQTL analysis, we excluded individuals with non-European ancestry. Post-sequencing, two samples that failed RNAseq quality control procedures and one that was an outlier in genotype principal component analysis were removed from the study.

Journal.title: Genetic regulatory signatures underlying islet gene expression and type 2 diabetes
